passages.text: Forestry, Paper & Packaging
We publish our monthly volume, price and cost tracker for the forestry, paper and packaging industry.

Billerud, GPK, IP, MMK, Norske Skog, Ontex, PKG and Suzano are not covered by Barclays Research. Information about these companies is being provided for informational purposes only and is not and should not be considered an investment recommendation by Barclays Research.
In this note, we summarise volume, pricing and cost trends for the industry:

a) Containerboard and Corrugated Packaging (relevant for Smurfit Westrock, Mondi, International Paper, Packaging Corp of America, etc.) - US domestic OCC prices remained unchanged for the first 4 months of this year at c\\(66/ton, but began to decline in May. Prices have declined by\)\\(3/ton\) since June to \(\)56/ton\(. European OCC prices were also relatively stable from Jan - March but then rose by\)\epsilon 20 - 30\(in April and another\)\epsilon 30\(in May. However, prices decreased by\)\epsilon 20 - 30\(/tonne in July, and have now decreased a further\)\epsilon 20/tonne\(in August. In containerboard, European prices had increased, due largely to higher OCC costs. However, European testliner prices decreased by\)\epsilon 20 - 25/ton\(in August (we expect kraftliner to follow with a one month lag), whilst US testliner prices have remained stable. European kraftliner prices decreased by\)\epsilon 5/tonne\(in August, whilst US kraftliner remained stable.

b) Pulp and Paper (relevant for UPM, SCA, Stora Enso, Holmen, Essity, Ontex, etc.) - We note that the SHFE (Shanghai Futures Exchange) Bleach Softwood Kraft Pulp Futures contract is down \(c10\%\) since the end of July. Chinese hardwood pulp prices are now \(c.5050/ton\) and softwood pulp prices are now \(c.690/ton\) . Suzano have announced a second price increase of \(\)20/\(ton BEK sales in Asia, effective from September (this follows an initial price increase of\)\\(20/ton\) in August). It will also include prices by \(\)80/\(ton BEK sales in Europe and North America, effective from September.

c) Consumer Board and Consumer Packaging (relevant for Huhtamaki, SIG, Graphic Packaging, Stora etc.) - Consumer board utilisation rates are \(c85\%\) in the US and low 80s in Europe - i.e. \(t\) over than historical levels. We think the industry is oversupplied. With new capacity being added, we believe utilisation rates will remain lower (than historical averages), which could lead to pressure on board prices in FY25. See our note here.

In the FP&P space, our key OWs are Smurfit Westrock (PT \(\)63/4700\(p), Huhtamaki (PT\)\epsilon 41\(), UPM (PT\)\epsilon 28\(), SIG (PT CHF18), which we prefer ahead of Mondi (EW, PT 1175p) and Stora Enso (EW, PT\)\epsilon 10.5\(), Holmen (UW, PT SEK360) and SCA (UW, PT SEK115).
This research report has been prepared in whole or in part by equity research analysts based outside the US who are not registered/qualified as research analysts with FINRA.
Please see analyst certifications and important disclosures beginning on page 17. Completed: 28- Aug- 25, 16:29 GMT Released: 29- Aug- 25, 09:00 GMT Restricted - External
European Small & Mid Cap NEUTRAL Unchanged European Consumer Staples NEUTRAL Unchanged

We analyse Nielsen volume trends across global FMCG companies, as they are key to assessing packaging volume trends. We also focus on volume trends by category within the European HPC hygiene sector, which is relevant for Ontex and Essity.
In the table below, we include an overview of the price movements across each of these categories.
FIGURE 1. Prices: pulp, containerboard, sack kraft, consumerboard and graphic paper

Note: 2Q25E for NBSK, European and BHK, Europe
Source: Company reports, Factset Markets RISI, Barclays Research estimates

In the the benchmark prices of kraftliner and testliner prices have remained stable over August on the EU, we had previously seen prices increase, driven largely by higher OCC costs. However, kraftliner prices decreased by c€5/ton in August, whilst testliner prices decreased - 25/ton in August. These are spot prices and, due to the lagged nature of contracts, price changes fall through to earnings with a 1- 2- quarter lag.
FIGURE 2. Americas: Testliner and Kraftliner prices have remained stable
FIGURE 3. Americas: Export prices have been stable since January
Source: Fastmarkets RISI, Barclays Research
Source: Fastmarkets RISI, Barclays Research
FIGURE 4. Europe: Kraftliner prices decreased c€5/ton in August whilst Testliner prices decreased by c€20-25/ton in August
FIGURE 5. Germany: Kraftliner prices decreased c€20/ton in August, whilst testliner prices decreased c€15-30/ton in August
Source: Fastmarkets RISI, Barclays Research
Source: Fastmarkets RISI, Barclays Research
FIGURE 6. PKG US Q2 25 volumes continue to outperform
Source: Bloomberg, Barclays Research

Source: Bloomberg, Barclays Research

Source: Company reports, Nielsen data, Barclays Research

We note that the SHFE (Shanghai Futures Exchange) Bleach Softwood Kraft Pulp Futures contract is down c10% since the end of July. We note the Chinese PIX BHKP prices have been down c- 18% since April, whilst PIX NBSK prices have been down c- 14%. Chinese hardwood pulp prices are now c. \(\) 505\(/ton and softwood pulp prices are now c.\) \ \(690\) /ton. Suzano have announced a second price increase of \(\) 20\(/ton BEK sales in Asia, effective from September (this follows an initial price increase of\) \ \(20\) /tin August). It will also increase prices by \(\) 80\(/ton BEK sales in Europe and North America, effective from September.
FIGURE 17. SHFE pulp futures are down c10% since the end of July
Source: Bloomberg, Barclays Research
FIGURE 18. Since April: European BHK prices have declined by c-14%, whilst NBSK prices have declined by c-6%
Source: Fastmarkets RISI, Barclays Research
FIGURE 19. Since April: Chinese PIX BHKP prices have been down c-18%, whilst PIX NBSK prices have been down c-14%
Source: Fastmarkets RISI, Barclays Research
Consumerboard prices have remained stable since January, although we have seen a decrease in coated duplex prices in Europe.
FIGURE 20. Consumerboard prices have generally been stable since January...
Source: Fastmarkets RISI, Barclays Research
FIGURE 21. ...but coated duplex has decreased c35/tonne since January
Source: Fastmarkets RISI, Barclays Research
FIGURE 22. Bleached sack kraft prices increased by €50/tonne and unbleached sack kraft prices increased by €45/tonne between January and July
Source: Fastmarkets RISI, Barclays Research
FIGURE 23. Milk volumes in Europe have seen a slight dip in the past few months
Source: Company reports, Barclays Research
Graphic paper prices have decreased by €10- 60/tonne since June. Over the last month we have seen pressure on uncoated wood- free pricing in Europe.
FIGURE 24. Germany: Graphic paper prices have decreased by €10-60/tonne since June
Source: Bloomberg, Barclays Research
FIGURE 25. PIX Graphic paper prices have been flat to slightly down since January
Source: Fastmarkets RISI, Barclays Research

US domestic OCC prices remained unchanged for the first 4 months of this year at c\$66/ton, but began to decline in May. Prices have declined by \$3/ton since June to c\$56/ton in August. European OCC prices were also relatively stable from Jan- March, rose by c€20- 30 in April and another €30 in May. However, prices decreased by c€20- 30/tonne in July and have now decreased a further c€20/tonne in August.
FIGURE 26. OCC prices are declining in the US...
FIGURE 27. ...and in Europe
Source: Fastmarkets RISI, Barclays Research
Source: Fastmarkets RISI, Barclays Research

We, Gaurav Jain, Pallav Mittal and Morayo Adesina, hereby certify (1) that the views expressed in this research report accurately reflect our personal views about any or all of the subject securities or issuers referred to in this research report and (2) no part of our compensation was, is or will be directly or indirectly related to the specific recommendations or views expressed in this research report.
GD: One of the Research Analysts on the fundamental credit coverage team (and/or a member of his or her household) has a long position in the common equity securities of this issuer.
GE: One of the Research Analysts on the fundamental equity coverage team (and/or a member of his or her household) has a long position in the common equity securities of this issuer.
H: This issuer beneficially owns more than \(5\%\) of any class of common equity securities of Barclays PLC.

P: A partner, director or officer of Barclays Capital Canada Inc. has, during the preceding 12 months, provided services to the subject company for remuneration, other than normal course investment advisory or trade execution services.
R: Barclays Capital Canada Inc. has received compensation for investment banking services from this issuer in the past 12 months.
S: This issuer is a Corporate Broker to Barclays PLC.
U: The equity securities of this Canadian issuer include subordinate voting restricted shares.
V: The equity securities of this Canadian issuer include non- voting restricted shares.
The Nielsen material contained in this report represents Nielsen estimates and does not represent facts. Nielsen has neither reviewed nor approved this report and/or any of the statement made herein.
Overweight - The stock is expected to outperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a 12- month investment horizon.
Equal Weight - The stock is expected to perform in line with the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a 12- month investment horizon.
Underweight - The stock is expected to underperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a 12- month investment horizon.
**Positive** - industry coverage universe fundamentals/valuations are improving.
**Neutral** - industry coverage universe fundamentals/valuations are steady, neither improving nor deteriorating.
**Negative** - industry coverage universe fundamentals/valuations are deteriorating.

Sustainable Investing Related Research: There is currently no globally accepted framework or definition (legal, regulatory or otherwise) of, nor market consensus as to what constitutes a 'sustainable', 'ESG', 'green', 'climate-friendly' or an equivalent company, investment, strategy or consideration or what precise attributes are required to be eligible to be categorised by such terms. This means there are different ways to evaluate a company or an investment and so different values may be placed on certain sustainability credentials as well as adverse ESG- related impacts of companies and ESG controversies. The evolving nature of sustainable investing considerations, models and methodologies means it can be challenging to definitively and universally classify a company or investment under a sustainable investing label and there may be areas where such companies and investments could improve or where adverse ESG- related impacts or ESG controversies exist. The evolving nature of sustainable finance related regulations and the development of jurisdiction- specific regulatory criteria also means that there is likely to be a degree of divergence as to the interpretation of such terms in the market. We expect industry guidance, market practice, and regulations in this field to continue to evolve.

Any information, data, image, or other content including from a third party source contained, referred to herein or used for whatsoever purpose by Barclays or a third party ("Information"), in relation to any actual or potential 'ESG', 'sustainable' or equivalent objective, issue, factor or consideration is not intended to be relied upon for ESG or sustainability classification, regulatory regime or industry initiative purposes ("ESG Regimes"), unless otherwise stated. Nothing in these materials, including any images included therein, is intended to convey, suggest or indicate that Barclays considers or represents any product, service, person or body mentioned in these materials as meeting or qualifying for any ESG or sustainability classification, label or similar standards that may exist under ESG Regimes. Barclays has not conducted any assessment of compliance with ESG Regimes. Parties are reminded to make their own assessments for these purposes.

IRS Circular 230 Prepared Materials Disclaimer: Barclays does not provide tax advice and nothing contained herein should be construed to be tax advice. Please be advised that any discussion of U.S. tax matters contained herein (including any attachments) (i) is not intended or written to be used, and cannot be used, by you for the purpose of avoiding U.S. tax- related penalties; and (ii) was written to support the promotion or marketing of the transactions or other matters addressed herein. Accordingly, you should seek advice based on your particular circumstances from an independent tax advisor.
